subject: Education
title: Sleep and the Learning Brain
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sleep and the Learning Brain.

hook.text: Children who sleep one hour less per night show cognitive deficits equivalent to two years of brain development.

buildup.text: During sleep, the brain consolidates memories, strengthens neural connections, and clears metabolic waste.

discovery.text: Teenagers need 9 hours of sleep but their circadian rhythm shifts late. Starting school at 7:30 AM fights their biology.

twist.text: Schools that delayed start times saw grades improve, depression drop, and car accidents decrease by 70%.

climax.text: Sleep isn't rest â€” it's when the brain processes everything learned during the day. Cutting sleep cuts learning.

punchline.text: The best study hack isn't studying more. It's sleeping more.
